00001 /*
00002 ###############################################################################
00003 #
00004 #  EGSnrc egs++ smart envelope geometry headers
00005 #  Copyright (C) 2015 National Research Council Canada
00006 #
00007 #  This file is part of EGSnrc.
00008 #
00009 #  EGSnrc is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00010 #  the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published by the
00011 #  Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your
00012 #  option) any later version.
00013 #
00014 #  EGSnrc is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
00015 #  WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS
00016 #  FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU Affero General Public License for
00017 #  more details.
00018 #
00019 #  You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
00020 #  along with EGSnrc. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
00021 #
00022 ###############################################################################
00023 #
00024 #  Author:          Iwan Kawrakow, 2008
00025 #
00026 #  Contributors:    Frederic Tessier
00027 #
00028 ###############################################################################
00029 #
00030 #  A "smart" envelope geometry. The smartness is due to the fact that there
00031 #  can be only zero or one inscribed geometry per base geometry region, which
00032 #  makes many of the checks faster.
00033 #
00034 #  In addition, unlike the regular envelope geometry where all inscribed
00035 #  geometries always must completely fit inside the base geometry, here
00036 #  geometries can be inscribed using logic 0 or 1.
00037 #
00038 #  Logic 0 is as before, i.e., geometry must completely fit into the region
00039 #  where it is being inscribed.
00040 #
00041 #  Logic 1 means that the inscribed geometry extends beyond the region and
00042 #  therefore the smart envelope also checks the base geometry in this case.
00043 #  This is very similar to a CD geometry except that now the space outside
00044 #  the inscribed geometry is still part of the geometry.
00045 #
00046 #  Warning: not completely tested, so don't use for production runs yet.
00047 #
00048 ###############################################################################
00049 */
00050 
00051

00137 class EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_EXPORT EGS_SmartEnvelope : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00138 
00139 public:
00140 
00141     EGS_SmartEnvelope(EGS_BaseGeometry *G,
00142                       const vector<SmartEnvelopeAux *> &fgeoms, const string &Name = "");
00143 
00144     ~EGS_SmartEnvelope();
00145 
00146     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00147         return g->isInside(x);
00148     };
00149 
00150     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00151         int ibase = g->isWhere(x);
00152         if (ibase < 0) {
00153             return ibase;
00154         }
00155         int j = gindex[ibase];
00156         if (j >= 0) {
00157             int i = geometries[j]->isWhere(x);
00158             if (i >= 0) {
00159                 ibase = local_start[j] + i;
00160             }
00161         }
00162         return ibase;
00163     };
00164 
00165     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00166         return isWhere(x);
00167     };
00168 
00169     bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
00170         if (ireg < nbase) {
00171             return g->isRealRegion(ireg);
00172         }
00173         int i = ireg - nbase;
00174         int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00175         return geometries[j]->isRealRegion(ireg-local_start[j]);
00176     };
00177 
00178     int medium(int ireg) const {
00179         if (ireg < nbase) {
00180             return g->medium(ireg);
00181         }
00182         int i = ireg - nbase;
00183         int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00184         return geometries[j]->medium(ireg-local_start[j]);
00185     };
00186 
00187     EGS_Float howfarToOutside(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x,
00188                               const EGS_Vector &u) {
00189         if (ireg < 0) {
00190             return 0;
00191         }
00192         int ibase = ireg < nbase ? ireg : reg_to_base[ireg-nbase];
00193         return g->howfarToOutside(ibase,x,u);
00194     };
00195 
00196     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00197                EGS_Float &t, int *newmed = 0, EGS_Vector *normal = 0) {
00198         if (ireg >= 0) {
00199             // inside.
00200             if (ireg < nbase) {
00201                 // in one of the regions of the base geometry
00202                 // check if we hit a boundary in the base geometry.
00203                 // if we do, newmed and normal get set accordingly.
00204                 int ibase = g->howfar(ireg,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00205                 int j = gindex[ireg];
00206                 if (j >= 0) {
00207                     // there is an inscribed geometry in this region
00208                     // => check if we will enter
00209                     int inscr = geometries[j]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00210                     if (inscr >= 0)
00211                         // yes, we do.
00212                     {
00213                         return local_start[j] + inscr;
00214                     }
00215                 }
00216                 if (ibase == ireg || ibase < 0) {
00217                     return ibase;
00218                 }
00219                 // if here, we enter a new base geometry region.
00220                 j = gindex[ibase];
00221                 if (j >= 0 && itype[j]) {
00222                     // geometry inscribed in the new base region
00223                     // using inscription type 1 => check if already
00224                     // inside the inscribed
00225                     int inscr = geometries[j]->isWhere(x+u*t);
00226                     if (inscr >= 0) {
00227                         if (newmed) {
00228                             *newmed = geometries[j]->medium(inscr);
00229                         }
00230                         return local_start[j] + inscr;
00231                     }
00232                 }
00233                 return ibase;
00234             }
00235             // if here, we are in an inscribed geometry.
00236             int i = ireg-nbase;
00237             int ibase = reg_to_base[i];
00238             int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00239             int ilocal = ireg-local_start[j];
00240             int inew = geometries[j]->howfar(ilocal,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00241             if (itype[j]) {
00242                 int ibase_new = g->howfar(ibase,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00243                 if (ibase_new != ibase) {
00244                     if (ibase_new < 0) {
00245                         return ibase_new;
00246                     }
00247                     j = gindex[ibase_new];
00248                     if (j >= 0 && itype[j]) {
00249                         int inscr = geometries[j]->isWhere(x+u*t);
00250                         if (inscr >= 0) {
00251                             if (newmed) {
00252                                 *newmed = geometries[j]->medium(inscr);
00253                             }
00254                             return local_start[j] + inscr;
00255                         }
00256                     }
00257                     return ibase_new;
00258                 }
00259             }
00260             if (inew < 0) {
00261                 if (newmed) {
00262                     *newmed = g->medium(ibase);
00263                 }
00264                 return ibase;
00265             }
00266             return local_start[j] + inew;
00267         }
00268         // if here, we are outside the base geometry.
00269         // check to see if we will enter.
00270         int ibase = g->howfar(ireg,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00271         if (ibase >= 0) {
00272             int j = gindex[ibase];
00273             if (j >= 0 && itype[j]) {
00274                 int inscr = geometries[j]->isWhere(x+u*t);
00275                 if (inscr >= 0) {
00276                     if (newmed) {
00277                         *newmed = geometries[j]->medium(inscr);
00278                     }
00279                     return local_start[j] + inscr;
00280                 }
00281             }
00282         }
00283         return ibase;
00284     };
00285 
00286     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00287         if (ireg >= 0) {
00288             EGS_Float tmin;
00289             if (ireg < nbase) {  // in one of the regions of the base geom.
00290                 tmin = g->hownear(ireg,x);
00291                 if (tmin <= 0) {
00292                     return tmin;
00293                 }
00294                 int j = gindex[ireg];
00295                 if (j >= 0) {
00296                     EGS_Float ti = geometries[j]->hownear(-1,x);
00297                     if (ti < tmin) {
00298                         tmin = ti;
00299                     }
00300                 }
00301                 return tmin;
00302             }
00303             int i = ireg-nbase;
00304             int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00305             int ilocal = ireg-local_start[j];
00306             tmin = geometries[j]->hownear(ilocal,x);
00307             if (itype[j]) {
00308                 int ibase = reg_to_base[i];
00309                 EGS_Float tbase = g->hownear(ibase,x);
00310                 if (tbase < tmin) {
00311                     tmin = tbase;
00312                 }
00313             }
00314             return tmin;
00315         }
00316         return g->hownear(ireg,x);
00317     };
00318 
00319     int getMaxStep() const {
00320         int nstep = g->getMaxStep() + n_in;
00321         for (int j=0; j<n_in; ++j) {
00322             nstep += geometries[j]->getMaxStep();
00323         }
00324         return nstep;
00325     };
00326 
00327     bool hasBooleanProperty(int ireg, EGS_BPType prop) const {
00328         if (ireg >= 0 && ireg < nreg) {
00329             if (ireg < nbase) {
00330                 return g->hasBooleanProperty(ireg,prop);
00331             }
00332             int i = ireg-nbase, j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00333             return geometries[j]->hasBooleanProperty(ireg-local_start[j],prop);
00334         }
00335         return false;
00336     };
00337     void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType) {
00338         setPropertyError("setBooleanProperty()");
00339     };
00340     void addBooleanProperty(int) {
00341         setPropertyError("addBooleanProperty()");
00342     };
00343     void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType,int,int,int step=1) {
00344         setPropertyError("setBooleanProperty()");
00345     };
00346     void addBooleanProperty(int,int,int,int step=1) {
00347         setPropertyError("addBooleanProperty()");
00348     };

00350     const string &getType() const {
00351         return type;
00352     };
00353 
00354     void printInfo() const;
00355 
00356     void setRelativeRho(int start, int end, EGS_Float rho);
00357     void setRelativeRho(EGS_Input *);
00358     EGS_Float getRelativeRho(int ireg) const {
00359         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg) {
00360             return 1;
00361         }
00362         if (ireg < nbase) {
00363             return g->getRelativeRho(ireg);
00364         }
00365         int i = ireg-nbase;
00366         int j = reg_to_inscr[i];
00367         return geometries[j]->getRelativeRho(ireg-local_start[j]);
00368     };

00379     int *reg_to_base;         
00380     int *local_start;

00382     int              n_in;         
00383     int              nbase;

00397     void setPropertyError(const char *funcname) {
00398         egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope::%s: don't use this method\n  Define "
00399                  "properties in the constituent geometries instead\n",
00400                  funcname);
00401     };
